diagnosis.final_diagnosis: X-linked polyhydramnios with transient antenatal Bartter’s syndrome caused by MAGED2 mutations
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: Mutations in MAGED2 were identified in all affected infants presenting with transient antenatal Bartter’s syndrome. Early-onset severe polyhydramnios and prematurity were observed, which corresponded with the identified genetic defect. The symptoms spontaneously resolved postnatally, indicating the transient nature of the condition.
